intro: Phragmipedium × richteri var. merinoi, commonly known as the Merino phragmipedium, is a hybrid orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous inflorescences that bear showy, fragrant flowers with a unique coloration pattern. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a rosette, aiding in water retention. This variety is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively ease of cultivation under the right conditions.
